definition: out of control/berserk/to go for a long walk
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
people who go on walks for exercise/(Tw) rebel youth motorcycle group
Heelys (roller shoes with wheels protruding slightly from the heel)

sentences.english: Teddy: Yes. Because whenever mama bear comes out of her cave, bad things happen.
sentences.chinese: 因爲只要暴走熊媽媽出洞，壞事就會接二連三地發生。

sentences.english: Vincent argued back and suddenly Jobs went ballistic.
sentences.chinese: Vincen反駁他，突然間喬布斯暴走了。

sentences.english: One day, the main computer of the research became malicious and went berserk.
sentences.chinese: 這天，研究所裏的智能電腦突然異變暴走。

sentences.english: Mama bear is going into hibernation.
sentences.chinese: 暴走熊媽媽要去冬眠了。

definition: to flip out/to act out violently
to fly into a rage/to rage violently
(of a spirit or deity) to possess sb
to go mad/to go crazy/to lose one's mind
to explode/spontaneous detonation/self-detonation/suicide bombing/to disclose private matters about oneself
hurricane/violent reform or revolution/violent movement or force
to break out/to erupt/to explode/to burst out
